alert.note: Alert for Comanche; Grady; Oklahoma (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 23 at 7:59AM CST until February 23 at 10:00AM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy mixed precipitation expected. Sleet accumulations of up to one inch, and ice accumulations of a light glaze. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 5 below zero. * WHERE...Oklahoma and Grady Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 6 AM this morning to 6 PM CST Thursday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 10 AM CST this morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be nearly impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The cold wind chills could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. For the latest road conditions call 8 4 4 4 6 5 4 9 9 7.
